course.subject: MARK
course.name: Tools for Advanced Consumer Insights
course.description: This course for business students teaches a specific method for obtaining valid and reliable information on how and, more importantly, why consumers behave the way they do. The method taught in this course allows drawing causal inferences about the behavior of consumers, thus conferring managers the power to make informed predictions about how consumers will respond to marketing stimuli, positively impacting the development of marketing strategies and marketing mix decisions. Managers mastering this tool will be able to develop better products and services and promote them more effectively. Additionally, in this course students will gain advanced-level insights concerning consumer behavior, particularly about factors that make consumers act “irrationally”. The course is directed at students preparing for brand/product management, business development, or consulting positions.

reviews.author: Angel
reviews.title: one of the best marketing courses so far
reviews.comment_content: The amount of content is quite okay. You won't have massive amount of new knowledge to learn, yet the content you learnt here is very useful and it really gives you lots of useful insights.
reviews.comment_teaching: Maria is such a nice professor. She explains things very clearly and really appreciate any types of questions that brought to her.
reviews.comment_grading: Since it is a summer course, the grading is very nice when compared to other marketing courses
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is really low when compared to other marketing courses. 2 quizzes(only select the best out of two), one group presentation and one final paper presentation. For the group presentation, you only need to summarize the content from a chapter of the textbook and one academic paper that Maria gave to you. So you don't need to search for extra materials.
